title: Space Rider Nose Cone Passes Key Milestone
summary:
The Italian Aerospace Research Centre (CIRA) has completed the structural dynamic qualification testing campaign of the Space Rider nose cone, marking a key milestone in the development of the vehicle’s Thermal Protection System. Space Rider consists of two main sections: the expendable Service Module and the reusable Re-entry Module. The latter is designed to fly […]

title: Chief Training Officer Teresa Sindelar Touches the Future of Human Spaceflight
summary: Teresa Sindelar always knew she wanted to be a part of human spaceflight, but she was unsure how to make that dream a reality until a chance encounter with former NASA astronaut Tom Stafford when she was 11 years old. title: You can’t judge a star by its protoplanetary disc
summary: This image tells the story of redemption for one lonely star. The young star MP Mus (PDS 66) was thought to be all alone in the Universe, surrounded by nothing but a featureless band of gas and dust called a protoplanetary disc. In most cases, the material inside a protoplanetary disc condenses to form new planets around the star, leaving large gaps where the gas and dust used to be. These features are seen in almost every disc – but not in MP Mus’s.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch unspecified satellite on a Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: SpaceX disclosed neither the payload nor the customer for this mission launching from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. Liftoff of the Falcon 9 rocket is scheduled for 1:04 a.m. EDT (0504 UTC), the opening of a 3.5-hour window.
